author: m.kalinin
content: AFAIK, there is no specific address anywhere, it's just geth not accepting all zeroes, other clients may still accept it though. Probably the idea of not accepting it in geth is preventing misconfiguration when mining/block production is enabled but coinbase isn't specified cc <@360491619402776577>

author: sky.cactus
content: I think if it is your turn to produce a block, it is better to mine with 0 and very noisily warn than it is to skip block production entirely.

author: sky.cactus
content: I would accept hard failing during startup if the address is 0, in hopes that the person will notice before it is their turn to produce a block.

author: m.kalinin
content: The problem is that fee recipient address becomes external for EL side, so, it's more about VC design to avoid startups with misconfigured fee recipient

author: sky.cactus
content: I would support Geth blindly accepting anything and leaving it up to the VC to do.
